title: Trash Talk vs. Toxicity
body:
I would consider my self a reasonably toxic player, I trash talk everyone every single game and consistently make it my mission to ruin the days of the other 9 poor souls who are trapped in a game with me (i never intentionally feed or afk though, that's fkn gai).

Yet I almost never get banned, in fact, my only ever ban was me trying to intentionally get banned just to see if my account was immortal to bans or something  (it wasn't).

Almost all my friends would get banned but I never would and I started to wonder what the difference was between me and them and through some deep evaluation of my toxic tendencies and the toxic tendencies of my banned friends I found a discrepancy.

All my toxic comments were related to in-game performance, I would always trash on a player for sucking at their role or doing poorly in their position whereas other banned players would use personal insults and attacks. In fact, the only time I was ever banned was because I was using personally offensive insults towards another player.

It seems to me like as long as you don't say anything racist or tell someone to commit self-harm you will rarely ever get banned. At least that's what it seems like to me, (also note most of my toxicity is directed towards the enemy team).

At least that's how it seems to me, it would be helpful if anyone reading to post about their previous experiences with the player tribunal so I could better understand the way in which the LoL algorithm detects toxicity.

You absolutely should be banned for calling someone trash. Play with the intent of being respectful of everyone or don't play the game at all.

As a person who knows people who have accounts banned - as well as myself.

You are right, in the sense that these comments can get you banned:

- Racism
- Suicidal comments
- Psychological (or mental) bullying

But you (obviously) can get banned for:

- Inting
- Trolling
- Ddosing (must have proof though)

I do believe that there is a hole in the tribunal system, in the sense that people get away with stuff too easily.

Of course I was toxic enough get myself banned (permanently), but there are also others that should get at least a chat ban (such as yourself - just saying), but do not.

I think that this system has to be updated, or at least looked into, because people are finding ways to kinda juke their way out of this banning system.

The worst offending comments that don't get banned - or even chat banned - are those who call out 'Your Mum' for the simple reason, that someone on their team could be doing badly - in which everyone has those games, regardless of skill - but that is no excuse for them to talk this way (hypocritical I know).

TLDR:

Tribunal should update since people are finding ways to evade the system in the first place. Those who get away with it need to be at least chat banned for 5 - 10 games, on the rift (from the message I got when I got perma'd) "Everyone Deserves Respect" (and 0.006% have learnt the hard way).

League of legends motto
You chat? You banned.
